ref: 14712 phalph -- : Also in N. phāp ʻ prosperity, growth ʼ, phāpnu ʻ to be suitable ʼ; A. phāpiba ʻ to be effective (of drug or incantation) ʼ; -- *phabb -- (< *pharb -- )? in K. phabun ʻ to be suitable or becoming ʼ; S. phaḇaṇu ʻ to succeed ʼ; P. phabbṇā ʻ to look well ʼ; H. phābī ʻ fitting ʼ, phabnā ʻ to adorn, be suitable, swell with pleasure ʼ; <-> *phavv -- (< pharv -- in prapharvīˊ -- ʻ wanton girl ʼ RV.) in Pk. phavvīhaï ʻ is successful in getting ʼ (or for *phabbhī˚ < *pharbhīyati?); G. phāvvũ ʻ to succeed ʼ; M. phāvṇẽ ʻ to be suitable ʼ. -- See also *sparvati.
